body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Remove the rear wheel axle shaft (see
Final Drive/Rear Hub and Bearings - Removal
Remove as much of the old grease and debris as possible and check the needle roller bearing for damage, replace as necessary.
, into the needle roller bearing on the right hand side of the hub.
Attach a grease gun, containing grease to NLGI 2 specification, to the grease nipple.
Pump grease into the greasing tool until clean grease is seen to come out of the two holes adjacent to the grease nipple.
Remove the greasing tool and check that the bearing is adequately covered with clean grease.
Refit the rear wheel axle shaft (see
Final Drive/Rear Hub and Bearings - Installation - All Parts
